Name: Marine Drive
Discription: Marine Drive, officially known as Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Marg, is a 3 kilometre long boulevard which stretches from Nariman Point to Malabar Hills. It is an inverted 'C'-shaped six lane road in southern Mumbai, running along the coast of the Arabian Sea. Famed for a large number of Art ...

Name: Shree Siddhivinayak
Discription: Dedicated to Lord Siddhivinayak, a form of Lord Ganesha, Shree Siddhivinayak is one of Mumbai's holiest places. It is located strategically in Prabhadevi and is often frequented by Bollywood stars and other celebrities. It is believed that Ramakrishna Jambhekar Maharaj, a disciple of Hindu Saint Akkalkot Swami Samarth, buried two ...

Name: Bandra Worli Sea Link
Discription: Officially known as Rajiv Gandhi Sea Link, Bandra Worli Sea Link is an eight-lane cable-stayed bridge that links the regions of Bandra and Worli. It has pre-stressed concrete-steel viaducts on either side, which provide strength to it. The bridge is proposed to link the western suburbs of Mumbai with Nariman ...

Name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya
Discription: Earlier referred to as the Prince of Wales Museum of Western India, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (CSMVS) is one of the top cultural museums in India. The foundation stone of the museum was laid in 1905 by the Prince of Wales, and on 10th January, 1922, it was opened ...

Name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus
Discription: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, which was previously known as Victoria Terminus, is among the busiest railway stations in the country. An outstanding example of Victorian-Gothic architectural style, the railway station is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This splendid edifice, designed by F. W. Stevens, was built in the year 1887 to ...

Name: Chowpatty Beach
Discription: One of Mumbai's star attractions, Chowpatty Beach is located on the northern side of Marine Drive. Officially known as Girgaum Chowpatty, this public beach serves as a favourite picnic spot among locals and tourists. Lapped by the waters of the Arabian Sea, this beach is perfect for spending moments of ...

Name: Gateway of India
Discription: The Gateway of India is an emblematic landmark not only in Mumbai but in the entire country. Located on the southern part of the city, the gateway overlooks the splendid Arabian Sea. This magnificent edifice was constructed to memorialize King George V and Queen Mary's visit to India in 1911. ...

Name: Mani Bhavan Gandhi Sangrahalaya
Discription: Mani Bhavan Gandhi Sangrahalaya is an old two-storey building, which serves as a museum and research centre. Formerly a house of Shri Revashankar Jagjeevan Jhaveri – a friend and host of Mahatma Gandhi, this place served as Gandhiji’s home whenever he visited Mumbai. It was from here that Gandhiji initiated ...

Name: Shivaji Park
Discription: One of the largest parks in Mumbai, Shivaji Park is situated in Dadar. A popular hub for political and social meetings, this park holds great historical and cultural significance since before India got independence. Named after the heroic leader- Chhatrapati Shivaji, this park was established by the Mumbai Municipal Corporation ...

Name: Flora Fountain
Discription: Flora Fountain is a famous landmark that finds mention in the list of heritage structures across India. Western India’s Agri-Horticultural Society built it in 1864. It has been named after Flora – Roman Goddess of Flowers. In 1960, the Flora Fountain was renamed as Hutatma Chowk (Martyr's Square) in the ...

Name: RBI Monetary Museum
Discription: RBI Monetary Museum is a unique museum set up by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) – the most important financial institution of the country. Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam – the former President of India, inaugurated the museum in 2004. It aims at depicting the evolution of money in the ...

Name: Versova Beach
Discription: Versova Beach is a popular tourist spot in the suburbs of Andheri in Mumbai. This secluded seafront is an extension of the beautiful Juhu Beach, from which it is separated by a creek. The namesake village of this beach is known for being home to Kolis – a large fishing ...

Name: Adlabs Imagica
Discription: Adlabs Imagica is the latest addition to the seemingly endless list of entertainment hubs in Mumbai. Opened in April 2013, this theme park is gradually gaining popularity as a one-stop recreation centre in the city. It belongs to Adlabs Entertainment Limited, a renowned media firm owned by entrepreneur and film ...

Name: Aksa Beach
Discription: About 27 kilometres from Mumbai city, Aksa Beach is a wonderful place to visit. The waterfront has the base of the Indian navy – INS Hamla on one end, and a small beach – Dana Paani on the other. The salubrious weather, gentle sea breeze and picturesque environs of this ...

Name: Gorai Beach
Discription: Gorai Beach lies near Monari Beach, adjacent to Gorai Creek. The calmness of this beach makes it an ideal place to enjoy moments of repose. You can enjoy a leisurely walk by the shoreline, indulge in swimming or just laze around and bask in the sun here. It is a ...

Name: H2O Water Sports
Discription: Located in Chowpatty, just 3 kilometres away from Marine Drive, H2O Water Sports is a popular beachside water park that offers an ultimate experience of fun and adventure. It has a wide assortment of activities – from boating to jet skiing, sailing, water skiing, parasailing, wakeboarding and kayaking. You can ...

Name: Hakone
Discription: Situated in Hiranandani Gardens, Hakone is a one-stop destination for people of all ages. With a wide range of games, rides and dining options, this amusement park ensures you have an enjoyable time. Kids and adults can have fun at the Entertainment Centre that offers simulators, redemption machines and LAN ...

Name: Happy Planet
Discription: Happy Planet, located on Eastern Express Highway, is the perfect destination for leisure travellers in Mumbai. Sprawling over an area of 15000 sq ft, it is an exciting play land for people of all ages. From bumper boat, cannon shooting and inflatable to long and high slides (starting at 22 ...

Name: Jogger's Park
Discription: Jogger's Park is a 400 metre long jogging track along the beautiful coastline of Bandra in Mumbai. It is located near Otters Club, one of the premier clubs of the city. Late Sir Oliver Andrade gifted the Jogger's Park project and initiative as a token of love to the city. ...

Name: Kamala Nehru Park
Discription: Nestled in the posh Malabar Hill locality of Mumbai, Kamala Nehru Park is a tourist hotspot and popular picnic haunt in the city. This shoe-shaped park spans over an area of about 4000 sq ft that is covered with greenery. Shady trees are planted all across this green space. Colourful ...

Name: Madh Island
Discription: Approximately an hour's drive from the heart of the city, Madh Island is a site that possesses some of Maharashtra's most beautiful farmlands and fishing villages. For those who are in search of a peaceful place, this is an ideal place to be. It is a rural area with beautiful ...

Name: Mahakali Caves
Discription: Lying at an elevation of 230 feet above sea level in Andheri East, Mahakali Caves is a Buddhist monastery. Formerly known as Kondivita Caves, this site has great religious significance. It is a set of 19 rock-cut caves that was built between 1st century and 6th century. Carved out of ...

Name: Nariman Point
Discription: ariman Point is an upmarket area, which earns recognition as the business district of Mumbai. In terms of property trends and rates, this place ranks fourth in the list of world's most expensive office locations. This landmark is situated towards the southern tip of the famous Marine Drive, overlooking the ...

Name: Powai Lake
Discription: Powai Lake, built by the British in the year 1799, is an over 214-year old artificial lake in Powai (Mumbai). Located at an elevation of 58.5 m above sea level, this lake has a surface area of 2.1 sq km and varying depths that range between 3 m and 12 ...

Name: Priyadarshini Park and Sports Complex
Discription: Priyadarshini Park and Sports Complex is a popular sea-facing attraction that is frequented by locals and tourists throughout the year. Lush greenery blankets the park, offers a serene atmosphere. Mud tracks are formed in the park for brisk walking and jogging, which is why it is also famous as a ...

Name: Snow World
Discription: Would you like to experience snowfall in Mumbai? Well, given the geographical location of the city, it seems impossible. However, with Snow World that offers unique opportunities to indulge in snow sports and adventure activities in the city, it is possible! Come to Snow World, located in Kurla, and experience ...

Name: Five Gardens
Discription: Rejuvenate your senses at the beautiful Five Gardens! Created by Mancherji Joshi about 80 years ago, this plot lies between King's Circle and Dadar in Mumbai. Locals visit this beautifully manicured garden for spending moments of repose. At this garden, kids come to play while adults and old people come ...

Name: Keneseth Eliyahoo Synagogue
Discription: The Greek word 'synagogue' means 'house of prayer' and generally refers to Jewish prayer assemblies. Keneseth Eliyahoo Synagogue is a religious, heritage edifice, located in the Fort area of Mumbai. Jacob Elias Sassoon and his brothers built this old Orthodox synagogue in the honour of their father Eliyahoo Sassoon in ...

Name: Mahalakshmi Race Course
Discription: A prominent landmark in the vibrant city of Mumbai, Mahalakshmi Race Course earns recognition as one of the finest horse racing circuits across the Asiatic continent. The grandstand of this historical racecourse finds mention in the list of heritage structures in the country. Owned by the Royal Western India Turf ...

Name: Mumba Devi Temple
Discription: Mumba Devi Temple is a renowned shrine in Mumbai, from where the city also got its name. It is dedicated to Goddess Mumbadevi who is regarded as the guardian deity of the region. The temple was first built in 1675 at Bori Bunder but was reconstructed at its present site ...

Name: Mumbai Port Trust Garden
Discription: Located in Colaba at the southern tip of Mumbai, Mumbai Port Trust Garden (sometimes known as Sagar Upvan) is an ideal retreat. This beautiful green site is owned and maintained by the Mumbai Port Trust, which is evident from its name. The World Wildlife Fund (WWF) contributes in the maintenance ...

Name: Nehru Centre
Discription: Nehru Centre is a unique memorial complex dedicated to Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. Established in 1972, it pays tribute to this luminary leader in a distinct way by incorporating fresh ideas, promoting new talent and preserving the heritage of the nation. The building of this modern centre is as contemporary and ...

Name: Nehru Science Centre
Discription: Nehru Science Centre is a wonderful initiative that covers various aspects of science and technology in a way that is both interesting and informative. It is a part of the National Council of Science Museums (NCSM), which is the administrative body for around 25 science centres and museums across the ...

Name: Victoria Gardens or Jijamata Udyan
Discription: Jijamata Udyan, formerly known as Rani Bagh or Victoria Gardens, is a popular place of interest in Mumbai. Also known as Veermata Jijabai Bhonsle Udyan, this beautiful garden houses the popular Mumbai Zoological Park and Bhau Daji Lad Museum. This entire property was originally owned by Jewish businessman David Sassoon, ...

Name: Worli Sea Face
Discription: Featuring picturesque surroundings that are characterised by endless blue waters of the Arabian Sea and distant Haji Ali Dargah, Worli Sea Face is a posh area in South Mumbai. It is a business district and a major residential area, inhabited mostly by affluent people. Extending from the Worli Fort in ...

Name: Yazoo Park
Discription: Located in Virar West, Yazoo Park is a popular attraction where people from the city and beyond pour in for fun and recreation. From rides, musical fountains and rock shows to games, spa and dining, there are plenty of offerings. To spend a memorable weekend or to add some enthralment ...

Name: Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Museum
Discription: Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Museum of Mumbai earns recognition as the oldest museum in the city and the third oldest across the country. It was inaugurated in 1857 as an exhibition of India's beautiful art and crafts. The present site of this museum came into existence in 1872, when it ...

Name: National Centre for the Performing Arts
Discription: National Centre for the Performing Arts, abbreviated as NCPA, is an esteemed cultural institution in the vibrant metropolis of Mumbai. It is a multi-venue and multi-purpose complex that aims at promoting and preserving the rich Indian heritage - performing arts, literature, films and photography. This premier organisation plays host to ...

Name: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
Discription: Sanjay Gandhi National Park is a significant wildlife reserve which impresses visitors with its diverse flora and fauna. It was formed in 1969 by merging different forest reserves with the Borivali National Park, which was 20.26 sq km in area. The geographical expanse of the national park thus formed was ...

Name: Water Kingdom
Discription: Water Kingdom is an amusement park in Mumbai that is counted amongst the largest theme-based water parks across Asia. It is owned by Pan India Paryatan Private Limited (PIPPL), which is a part of the renowned Essel Group of Companies. This water park, along with the famous EsselWorld, covers an ...

Name: Church of St. Bonaventure
Discription: Located amidst verdant green surroundings of Madh, Church of St. Bonaventure is one of the oldest shrines in Mumbai. Believed to have been built during the early years of the 15th century, this religious edifice was constructed by Portuguese Franciscans. Situated on Erangal Beach, this church is a suitable place ...

Name: St. Michael's Church
Discription: St. Michael's Church, located in Mahim, is one of Mumbai’s oldest catholic churches. It is also known as the Mahim Church. Originally built in the year 1534, this shrine was rebuilt a number of times. The structure that stands at present was designed in the year 1973. By far, one ...

Name: Banganga
Discription: Banganga Tank is a sacred water reservoir, situated within the premises of the Walkeshwar Temple in Mumbai. It was constructed in AD 1127, under the patronage of a minister of the Silhara dynasty. The tank was destroyed during the Portuguese invasion but was rebuilt with the help of a donation ...

Name: Cathedral of the Holy Name
Discription: Cathedral of the Holy Name is a celebrated shrine that is highly regarded by the Christian community in Mumbai. Situated in the prominent commercial centre of Colaba, it stands as a reminder of the colonial era. The foundation stone of the building was laid on 9th July 1902 while it ...

Name: Dharavi
Discription: Some would find it quite ironic that Mumbai, the capital of Maharashtra and often called India’s financial capital, is home to one of the largest slums in the world. The area is known as Dharavi, which in many ways sum up the extreme paradoxes that exist in India. There is ...

Name: Haji Ali Dargah
Discription: Haji Ali Dargah is a celebrated Islamic shrine, which earns immense recognition across the globe. This white edifice is nestled on a small islet that lies away from the city's shoreline, almost in the middle of the Arabian Sea. The reason behind the popularity and prominence of this religious complex ...

Name: Hedavde Mahalaxmi Temple
Discription: Param Pujya Guruvarya Dadasaheb Hate Om Shree Maha Laxmi Mata Mandir Trust owns Hedavde Mahalaxmi Temple. The temple, situated in Hedavde village near Vasai, forms an important part of a famous Shakti Peetha. The Shakti Peetha to which this temple belongs is the one where Goddess Sati's ankle fell during ...

Name: ISKCON Temple Mumbai
Discription: ISKCON Temple Mumbai is built over four acres of land in Juhu. The foundation of this shrine was laid by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada during the 1970s. The main deity of the temple is Sri Sri Radha Rasabihari (Lord Krishna). Sri Sri Gaura-Nitai and Sri Sri Sita Rama Laxman Hanuman ...

Name: Jain Temple Mumbai
Discription: Jain Temple Mumbai, also known as Babu Amichand Panalal Adishwarji Jain Temple, is a popular place of religious significance. Located in Walkeshwar area, this shrine is dedicated to Adishwara – the founder of Jainism. It was built more than 100 years ago in 1904 and is larger than most of ...

Name: Kanheri Caves
Discription: A fascinating cluster of rock-cut monuments, Kanheri Caves is situated deep inside the famous Sanjay Gandhi National Park. These caves date back to the ancient times (3rd century BC to 11th century AD), and are believed to be the country's oldest and largest cave formations in a single hill. This ...

Name: Madh Fort
Discription: The Portuguese built Madh Fort, or Versova Fort, as a watchtower during the 17th century. However, the Portuguese lost this fort to the Marathas in the 1739 war. It stands proudly on the Madh Island, close to the Aksa Beach in Mumbai. Communities of local fishermen presently inhabit the area ...

Name: Narmadeshwar Mahadev Mandir
Discription: Lord Shiva, the Parameshwara or The Supreme God, is the main deity of the Narmadeshwar Mahadev Mandir in Mumbai. The temple houses a unique form of the deity known as Bana Lingam, which was obtained from the River Narmada. This Hindu shrine made of white marble is elegantly decorated with ...

Name: Nehru Planetarium
Discription: Nehru Planetarium, a part of the famous Nehru Centre, was inaugurated on 3rd March 1977 by the former Prime Minister of India - Indira Gandhi. It features a Digistar 3 projector, which was installed around a decade ago, in the year 2003. Over the decades, the planetarium has grown into ...

Name: Rajabai Clock Tower
Discription: Rajabai Clock Tower is situated within the compound of Fort Campus in the University of Mumbai. Sir Gilbert Scott designed the structure of the tower, which bears resemblance to London’s Clock Tower – Big Ben. Its foundation stone was laid in the year 1869 and has been named after Premchand ...

Name: Shree Balaji Mandir
Discription: Shree Balaji Mandir is a popular shrine dedicated to Lord Balaji, who is also known as God Venkateswara (a form of Hindu deity Vishnu). Shree Balaji Foundation, a registered Charitable Public Trust, manages this religious site. Located at Charkop in Mumbai, the shrine is thronged by pilgrims all around the ...

Name: St. Thomas Cathedral
Discription: St. Thomas Cathedral earns fame as the first Anglican church of erstwhile Bombay. It is a glorious testament of the several hundred years, during which the city stayed under the reign of the British East India Company. Named after Saint Thomas, one of the 12 apostles of Jesus Christ, this ...

Name: Taraporewala Aquarium
Discription: Taraporewala Aquarium, built in the year 1951, boasts of rich aquatic life. Dr. Rajendra Prasad, the first President of India, did the formal opening of this aquarium. It has been named after the Parsee man who donated around Rs. 200000 for the construction of this aquarium. On display are more ...

Name: Tower of Silence
Discription: The Tower of Silence, also known as Parsee Bawdi, is a sprawling graveyard that is situated in the posh Malabar Hill region of the city. Covering an area of 55 acres, this funeral ground is where the last rites of people belonging to the Parsee community are performed. ...

Name: Town Hall Asiatic Society Library
Discription: Overlooking the famous Horniman Circle Gardens in Mumbai's Fort area, Town Hall is one of the living reminders of Victorian Bombay. This colonial building was constructed in 1833 with funds from the Literary Society of Bombay and central government. Presently known as the Asiatic Society of Bombay, this learned group ...

Name: Walkeshwar Temple
Discription: Walkeshwar Temple, also known as the Banganga Temple, is an esteemed place of worship for Hindus. Lord Shiva is the prime deity of this temple, which lies in the South Mumbai region of the metropolis. As per legends, Lord Rama stopped here, while going to Lanka on His search for ...

Name: Asia Society
Discription: Asia Society in Mumbai is a premier educational organisation and cultural centre dedicated towards the promotion and expression of creative ideas. It is affiliated to the acclaimed Asia Society of New York which was founded in 1956 and has international presence across several nations. It aims at forming strong bonds ...

Name: Babington Point
Discription: Located at an elevation of 1294 metres above the sea level, Babington Point is a beautiful viewpoint on Tapola Road. Just 2.5 kilometres away from the main market, this site is easily accessible from any part of the hill station. The path leading to this enchanting destination is itself quite ...

Name: Colaba
Discription: Sprawling in Mumbai's southernmost peninsula, Colaba is a bustling district that is packed with heritage sites, street stalls, markets, restaurants, bars and assorted accommodation choices. Under Portuguese rule during the 16th century, this area was known as Candil. Later, when the British arrived, they renamed it as Colio. The current ...

Name: Indian Museum Ship Vikrant
Discription: Indian Museum Ship Vikrant is an aircraft carrier that was opened as a public museum during the Navy Week celebrations of 2012. Assembled in 1945 and purchased in 1957 by the Indian Navy, INS Vikrant is presently docked near the Gateway of India. It served the country during the Indo-Pak ...

Name: St. George Fort
Discription: St. George Fort or Fort George is a crumbled structure that stands in the Fort area of Mumbai. Named in praise of King George III, the fort reminds of the British empire's early days in India. It was built in 1769 at the site of the Dongri Fort, as an ...

Name: Konkan
Discription: Encompassing six coastal districts within its geographical territory, Konkan division forms an integral part of Maharashtra. Mumbai, Mumbai Suburbs, Sindhudurg, Raigad, Thane and Ratnagiri are the six districts that form this sprawling coastal belt. Bordering the western shore of the country, this region is replete with a plethora of natural ...
